data.text: Organization or program that offers advice, mentorship and resources to help small businesses grow.
The type of investment typically happens when a startup is in its early stages.
Self-fund using personal resources.
How fast you are spending your money.
A way to transition the ownership of your company to another company and pay back your investors.
When a startup’s shares of stock are made public for the first time.
A method used to validate a business concept quickly and cheaply when founding a new company or introducing a new product.
A technique which involves the development of a basic version of a new product that aims to satisfy its early adopters.
Short version of a business plan which presents key figures to potential investors in hopes of winning them over.
In the startup world occurs when a company quickly changes directions after previously targeting a different market segment.
The first round of small, early-stage investment from family members, friends, banks or an investor.
A company often in the tech or software sector worth over US$1 billion.
Financing provided by firms to small, high-risk, startup companies with large growth potential in return for equity.
Financing provided by firms to small, high-risk, startup companies with large growth potential in return for equity.
A process that involves giving or earning a right to a present or future payment, benefit or asset.
Percentage of the potential market you hoping or have captured.
it’s what investors expect to get for what they put in.
When you sell subscriptions to use the software you have designed.
When startups giving an equity percentage to person for his or her hard work in the company.
A document which tells what percentage of ownership and voting rights will the Investors get for putting funds in your business.
